thread.title: The truth about Sweden and immigration: a strong and generous country is struggling to cope
thread.title_full: The truth about Sweden and immigration: a strong and generous country is struggling to cope

author: Fraser Nelson
title: The truth about Sweden and immigration: a strong and generous country is struggling to cope
text:
T his article was originally published on January 28 2016. Donald Trump has come under heavy criticism for appearing to refer to a non-existent terror attack in Sweden . He later claimed that he was referring to a Fox News interview with Ami Horowitz on the impact of Sweden's open door refugee policy. The Fox report included claims of a cover up by elites of a surge in crime linked to migrants and a national culture of denial. Fraser Nelson's column from last year shows the complicated reality of Sweden's experience of mass immigration:
Watch | Trump refers to non-existent refugee 'incident' in Sweden during rally 00:45 I fell in love with my wife and her native Sweden at the same time, and with almost equal force. For 15 years I’ve been arguing about the country’s virtues with room-emptying enthusiasm.
From schools to childcare to pensions, Sweden has just seemed more advanced than us. A visit to Stockholm has always seemed like a trip to the future – a glimpse of how things...
